definition: to produce the opposite of the desired result
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
see 李适[Li3 Kuo4]
surname Shi
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: But Messrs Kasich and Walker, in particular, seem to have stirred unusually fierce opposition.
sentences.chinese: 不过对于卡斯奇和沃克尔两位来说，似乎适得其反。

sentences.english: It's kind of an obsession. That seems unnecessary and counterproductive.'
sentences.chinese: 这是一种执迷，看起来没有必要，而且适得其反。

sentences.english: We have to pay for the mistakes, but also to be overkill.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须支付的错误，而且会适得其反。

sentences.english: The effort comes just a year after a crackdown on pedophilia backfired.
sentences.chinese: 努力仅仅一年后，在打击恋童了适得其反的。

sentences.english: But the heavy hand of the government can be stifling here.
sentences.chinese: 但是政府这种大刀阔斧的做法可能会适得其反。

sentences.english: But to not practice, to not get an injury would be counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 但为了躲避伤病而因噎废食的做法只能是适得其反。

sentences.english: Children are life renewing itself, Captain Butler.
sentences.chinese: 钱是延长生命的，我的挣法适得其反。

sentences.english: Indeed, half-hearted human-rights diplomacy can backfire nastily.
sentences.chinese: 心术不正的人权外交可能适得其反。

sentences.english: I believe that exerting pressure cannot solve the problem but rather may lead to the contrary.
sentences.chinese: 我想施压不仅解决不了问题，反而可能会适得其反。

sentences.english: Some, like last year's infamous Buzz, backfired and were scrapped.
sentences.chinese: 像去年臭名昭著的巴兹，结果适得其反，最后被销毁。

sentences.english: Canvassing is considered to be bad form and is therefore counter—productive.
sentences.chinese: 游说拉票被认为是不好的形式，只会适得其反。

sentences.english: So far, though, Mr Obama's lamentable salesmanship has pushed harder the other way.
sentences.chinese: 然仍，知道目前，奥巴马令人惋惜的推销术适得其反。

sentences.english: I think this is almost always counter-productive.
sentences.chinese: 不过我觉得这几乎总是适得其反的。

sentences.english: If what you’re saying is not compelling, it could backfire.
sentences.chinese: 如果你说的话本身就不具可信性，就只能适得其反了。

sentences.english: It may seem counterproductive to those of you trying to lose weight to eat before a work-out.
sentences.chinese: 在工作时如果你努力地想要减肥，可能会适得其反。

sentences.english: The un skilled novice can misuse the principle and get himself fired quite easily.
sentences.chinese: 拍得技巧不够可能会适得其反，很容易引火烧身。

definition: to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
opposite reaction
twice the effort for half the result
harmful and without benefit (idiom); more harm than good
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
blindly/invariably
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
reverse psychology
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
excessive/over-/excess/going too far/extravagant/intemperate/overdue
